author: Staff Reporter
text:
The City Municipal Corporation’s council meeting on Friday lasted for less than 20 minutes and ended without any discussions.

The house began with Mayor S. Soundappan reading a message to condole the death of a former councillor and thereafter members observing two-minute silence. Ward 3 councillor A.K.S. Balu demanded that white marking on city roads should be done after re-laying them. He also wanted installation of LED lights on the Five Road – Kuranguchavadi stretch, and also leakage in the water pipeline to be attended.

Corporation Commissioner K.R. Selvaraj said that permission had to be obtained from the National Highways Authority of India for repairing the pipeline as it came beneath the Bengaluru – Madurai NH in the city.

DMK’s leader of the house M. Bhuvaneswari said that the civic body failed to implement any schemes for the welfare of people. The Mayor immediately brought the session to an end and declared all resolutions as passed.

Addressing reporters, she said that the civic body failed to complete the major schemes brought by the previous DMK regime. She alleged irregularities in sanctioning funds for installing name boards for streets, purchase of machines for biometric attendance system among others.

“The Corporation refuses to give details under the RTI Act also,” she said.

Earlier, DMK councillors garlanded a poster with a message “Corporation is dead” and also blew the sangu (conch) before the beginning of the session.
title: Council meeting ends without discussions
